moves.1. c3: The Saragossa opening. I don't see any strategy to it.
moves.1... e5: I respond by grabbing the center
moves.2. e4 Nf6 3. Qa4: White defends with his queen. It's best not to move the queen this early in the game because developing pieces can attack it and force it to move.
moves.3... Nc6 4. Bc4: White attacks black's weak f7 pawn.
moves.4... Nxe4: White's bishop blocked the queen's rank, allowing this capture.
moves.5... Nc5: Black moves his knight to safety and attacks the white queen, forcing it to move.
moves.6. Qc2 d6: Black gains a diagonal for his c8 bishop.
moves.10. b5: Another attack! White's pawns are suffocating.
moves.12... Bf5: An attack on the d3 pawn
moves.13... Nxd3+: Black plans to grab the g4 pawn later.
moves.14. Kf1 Nc4: Black forgot about the g4 pawn
moves.15. gxf5 Nf4: Black moves his knight away from the queen.
moves.16. f6 Bxf6: Black takes the pawn without noticing that...
